fixes.name: Notional Amount T-1
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR useCustom = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
VAR startDate = SELECTEDVALUE('Start Date'[Display As])
RETURN
IF(
    useCustom,
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[MAX_DATE -1day] = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE],
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[NOTIONAL_AMOUNT],
        0
    ),
    IF(
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE] = startDate,
        'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[NOTIONAL_AMOUNT],
        0
    )
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Rewrote the nested Tableau IF logic into DAX using IF. Parameter references were converted to SELECTEDVALUE('ParameterName'[Display As]) as required. All column references were converted to 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[ColumnName] format. The logic returns NOTIONAL_AMOUNT when the specified date conditions are met, otherwise 0.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references parameters, and all parameter-based calculations must be measures.
